content.description: Fun right-facing corner climb. If you go past the first set of anchors, it will turn into Transvestite which is listed as a 5.11a.
content.protection: 11 bolts to steel biners at the top
content.location: To the right of a wide crack and large blocks stacked against the wall.

content.description: Nice, converges with Sidestepper at mid height, both can be climbed at same time by different parties
content.location: Left of Ingenue, right of Recess Wall, #121 on Page 71 of guidebook "Mazama Rock"

content.description: This route starts just to the right of Stairstepper. It converges with Stairstepper at the first band of broken rocks (and easier climbing). A few bolts in the chimney leads to a diverging route, follow the bolts to the right.
content.location: Just to the right of Stairstepper

content.description: Go up the chimney. Lots of good holds and stemming.
content.location: Right of Kissing Bandit in the Chimney

content.description: Climb the bolted buttress right of the chimney on small edges trending leftwards.
content.location: Just right of Firewater which is the big varied crack with the single bolt.

content.description: The route pulls three successive small roofs before wondering right back to the anchors near the chimney beside an overhanging block. (Route gets morning and mid-day shade) Look carfully, some of the bolts are camouflaged and extended alpine draws may help with rope drag. Note: shares anchors with a variation of Recessive Jeans
content.protection: 8 Quick Draws (Bolts older but in good condition) Bolted anchor with repel chains
content.location: Follow a bolt line starting on a blocky zebra striped arête just left of a chimney with a natural seep tucked inside an alcove at its base. The alcove is located in the middle of recess wall at the Prospector's crag.

content.description: The route starts with a thin low angle slab, and moves into a right facing dihedral. The holds are all there, but it can be cryptic at times, and requires some fancy stemming. One of the best routes at Prospector.
content.protection: 13 bolts. The route also has two trad variations that both start about half way up and branch to either side.
content.location: The route is located past the recess wall, isolated near the middle.

content.description: The route follows a thin crack on a less than vertical face.  It is very short, but a lot of fun.  There is definitely a super thin for the grade crux about half way up, that could make you nervous, enjoy!
content.protection: Gear to 1" and 1 bolt when the crack runs out before the chains.
content.location: Follow the trail about 30 yds. past the Recess Wall.  Find the thin right diagonal crack that dead ends at the fractured rock layer half way up the wall.

content.description: Fun climbing up a couple slightly overhanging sections

A thin move above the first bolt, a questionably placed second bolt, then decent climbing to a rightward move. The rightward move shouldn't be too far above the bolt. Then a tricky bulge, some choss, and a steep juggy finish.
content.location: Left side of Recess Wall. Look for a smooth slab to start.

content.description: This is the varied crack to the right of the chimney with a solitary bolt to signify it.  Since you probably didn't lug a rack up there, it can be top-roped from Rainmaker if you whip the rope around the horn at the top.
content.protection: Cams up to a #4 and one bolt.
